00040 /**
00041  * @file
00042  *
00043  * Module to support operations on bitmap of cores. Coremask can be used to
00044  * select a specific core, a group of cores, or all available cores, for
00045  * initialization and differentiation of roles within a single shared binary
00046  * executable image.
00047  *
00048  * The core numbers used in this file are the same value as what is found in
00049  * the COP0_EBASE register and the rdhwr 0 instruction.
00050  *
00051  * For the CN78XX and other multi-node environments the core numbers are not
00052  * contiguous.  The core numbers for the CN78XX are as follows:
00053  *
00054  * Node 0:  Cores 0 - 47
00055  * Node 1:  Cores 128 - 175
00056  * Node 2:  Cores 256 - 303
00057  * Node 3:  Cores 384 - 431
00058  *
00059  * The coremask environment generally tries to be node agnostic in order to
00060  * provide future compatibility if more cores are added to future processors
00061  * or more nodes are supported.
00062  *
00063  * <hr>$Revision: 156174 $<hr>
00064  *
00065  */
00066 
00067 #ifndef __CVMX_COREMASK_H__
00068 #define __CVMX_COREMASK_H__
00069 
00070 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00071 /* *INDENT-OFF* */
00072 extern "C" {
00073 /* *INDENT-ON* */
00074 #endif
00075 
00076 #include "cvmx-asm.h"
00077 
00078 typedef uint64_t cvmx_coremask_holder_t;    /* basic type to hold the
00079                            coremask bits */
00080 
00081 /* bits per holder */
00082 #define CVMX_COREMASK_HLDRSZ ((int)(sizeof(cvmx_coremask_holder_t) * 8))
00083 
00084 /** Maximum allowed cores per node */
00085 #define CVMX_COREMASK_MAX_CORES_PER_NODE (1 << CVMX_NODE_NO_SHIFT)
00086 
00087 /** Maximum number of bits actually used in the coremask */
00088 #define CVMX_MAX_USED_CORES_BMP (1 << (CVMX_NODE_NO_SHIFT + CVMX_NODE_BITS))
00089 
00090 /* the number of valid bits in and the mask of the most significant holder */
00091 #define CVMX_COREMASK_MSHLDR_NBITS (CVMX_MIPS_MAX_CORES % CVMX_COREMASK_HLDRSZ)
00092 #define CVMX_COREMASK_MSHLDR_MASK                   \
00093     ((CVMX_COREMASK_MSHLDR_NBITS) ?                 \
00094         (((cvmx_coremask_holder_t) 1 << CVMX_COREMASK_MSHLDR_NBITS) - 1) : \
00095         ((cvmx_coremask_holder_t) -1))
00096 
00097 /* cvmx_coremask_t's size in cvmx_coremask_holder_t */
00098 #define CVMX_COREMASK_BMPSZ                     \
00099     ((int)(CVMX_MIPS_MAX_CORES / CVMX_COREMASK_HLDRSZ +         \
00100         (CVMX_COREMASK_MSHLDR_NBITS != 0)))
00101 
00102 #define CVMX_COREMASK_USED_BMPSZ    \
00103     (CVMX_MAX_USED_CORES_BMP / CVMX_COREMASK_HLDRSZ)
00104 
00105 #define CVMX_COREMASK_BMP_NODE_CORE_IDX(node, core) \
00106     ((((node) << CVMX_NODE_NO_SHIFT) + (core)) / CVMX_COREMASK_HLDRSZ)
00107 /**
00108  * Maximum available coremask.
00109  */
00110 #define CVMX_COREMASK_MAX       \
00111     {{ 0x0000FFFFFFFFFFFF, 0,   \
00112        0x0000FFFFFFFFFFFF, 0,   \
00113        0x0000FFFFFFFFFFFF, 0,   \
00114        0x0000FFFFFFFFFFFF, 0,   \
00115        0, 0,            \
00116        0, 0,            \
00117        0, 0,            \
00118        0, 0}}
00119 
00120 /**
00121  * Empty coremask
00122  */
00123 #define CVMX_COREMASK_EMPTY     \
00124     {{ 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0,  \
00125        0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0}}
00126 
00127 /* cvmx_coremask_t */
00128 struct cvmx_coremask {
00129     cvmx_coremask_holder_t coremask_bitmap[CVMX_COREMASK_BMPSZ];
00130 };
00131 
00132 typedef struct cvmx_coremask cvmx_coremask_t;
00133 
00134 #if defined(CVMX_BUILD_FOR_LINUX_KERNEL)
00135 # define strtoull simple_strtoull
00136 # define strtoul simple_strtoul
00137 # include <linux/string.h>
00138 #elif defined(__U_BOOT__)
00139 # define strtoull simple_strtoull
00140 # define strtoul simple_strtoul
00141 # include <linux/string.h>
00142 # include "cvmx-platform.h"
00143 # include "cvmx-access.h"
00144 #else
00145 # include <string.h>
00146 # if !defined(__mips__)
00147 #  define cvmx_get_core_num() 0
00148 # else
00149 #  include "cvmx-platform.h"
00150 #  include "cvmx-access.h"
00151 # endif
00152 #endif
00153 
00154 /**
00155  * Macro to iterate through all available cores in a coremask
00156  *
00157  * @param core - core variable to use to iterate
00158  * @param pcm - pointer to core mask
00159  *
00160  * Use this like a for statement
00161  */
00162 #define cvmx_coremask_for_each_core(core, pcm)          \
00163     for ((core) = -1;                   \
00164         (core) = cvmx_coremask_next_core((core), pcm),  \
00165         (core) >= 0; )
00166 
00167 /**
00168  * Given a node and node mask, return the next available node.
00169  *
00170  * @param node      starting node number
00171  * @param node_mask node mask to use to find the next node
00172  *
00173  * @return next node number or -1 if no more nodes are available
00174  */
00175 static inline int cvmx_coremask_next_node(unsigned node, uint8_t node_mask)
00176 {
00177     int next_offset;
00178 
00179     next_offset = __builtin_ffs(node_mask >> (node + 1));
00180     if (next_offset == 0)
00181         return -1;
00182     else
00183         return node + next_offset;
00184 }
00185 
00186 /**
00187  * Iterate through all nodes in a node mask
00188  *
00189  * @param node      node iterator variable
00190  * @param node_mask mask to use for iterating
00191  *
00192  * Use this like a for statement
00193  */
00194 #define cvmx_coremask_for_each_node(node, node_mask)        \
00195     for ((node) = __builtin_ffs(node_mask) - 1;     \
00196          (node) >= 0 && (node) < CVMX_MAX_NODES;        \
00197          (node) = cvmx_coremask_next_node(node, node_mask))
00198 
00199 /**
00200  * Is ``core'' set in the coremask?
00201  *
00202  * @param pcm is the pointer to the coremask.
00203  * @param core
00204  * @return 1 if core is set and 0 if not.
00205  */
00206 static inline int cvmx_coremask_is_core_set(const cvmx_coremask_t *pcm,
00207                         int core)
00208 {
00209     int n, i;
00210 
00211     n = core % CVMX_COREMASK_HLDRSZ;
00212     i = core / CVMX_COREMASK_HLDRSZ;
00213 
00214     return (pcm->coremask_bitmap[i] & ((cvmx_coremask_holder_t)1 << n)) != 0;
00215 }
00216 
00217 /**
00218  * Is ``current core'' set in the coremask?
00219  *
00220  * @param pcm is the pointer to the coremask.
00221  * @return 1 if core is set and 0 if not.
00222  */
00223 static inline int cvmx_coremask_is_self_set(const cvmx_coremask_t *pcm)
00224 {
00225     return cvmx_coremask_is_core_set(pcm, (int)cvmx_get_core_num());
00226 }
00227 
00228 /**
00229  * Is coremask empty?
00230  * @param pcm is the pointer to the coremask.
00231  * @return 1 if *pcm is empty (all zeros), 0 if not empty.
00232  */
00233 static inline int cvmx_coremask_is_empty(const cvmx_coremask_t *pcm)
00234 {
00235     int i;
00236 
00237     for (i = 0; i < CVMX_COREMASK_USED_BMPSZ; i++)
00238         if (pcm->coremask_bitmap[i] != 0)
00239             return 0;
00240 
00241     return 1;
00242 }
00243 
00244 /**
00245  * Set ``core'' in the coremask.
00246  *
00247  * @param pcm is the pointer to the coremask.
00248  * @param core
00249  * @return 0.
00250  */
00251 static inline int cvmx_coremask_set_core(cvmx_coremask_t *pcm, int core)
00252 {
00253     int n, i;
00254 
00255     n = core % CVMX_COREMASK_HLDRSZ;
00256     i = core / CVMX_COREMASK_HLDRSZ;
00257     pcm->coremask_bitmap[i] |= ((cvmx_coremask_holder_t)1 << n);
00258 
00259     return 0;
00260 }
00261 
00262 #ifndef CVMX_BUILD_FOR_LINUX_HOST
00263 /* when run on HOST cvmx_get_core_num() is not applicable,
00264  * so this func as well
00265  */
00266 /**
00267  * Set ``current core'' in the coremask.
00268  *
00269  * @param pcm is the pointer to the coremask.
00270  * @return 0.
00271  */
00272 static inline int cvmx_coremask_set_self(cvmx_coremask_t *pcm)
00273 {
00274     return cvmx_coremask_set_core(pcm, (int)cvmx_get_core_num());
00275 }
00276 #endif
00277 
00278 /**
00279  * Clear ``core'' from the coremask.
00280  *
00281  * @param pcm is the pointer to the coremask.
00282  * @param core
00283  * @return 0.
00284  */
00285 static inline int cvmx_coremask_clear_core(cvmx_coremask_t *pcm, int core)
00286 {
00287     int n, i;
00288 
00289     n = core % CVMX_COREMASK_HLDRSZ;
00290     i = core / CVMX_COREMASK_HLDRSZ;
00291     pcm->coremask_bitmap[i] &= ~((cvmx_coremask_holder_t)1 << n);
00292 
00293     return 0;
00294 }
00295 
00296 #ifndef CVMX_BUILD_FOR_LINUX_HOST
00297 /* when run on HOST cvmx_get_core_num() is not applicable,
00298  * so this func as well
00299  */
00300 /**
00301  * Clear ``current core'' from the coremask.
00302  *
00303  * @param pcm is the pointer to the coremask.
00304  * @return 0.
00305  */
00306 static inline int cvmx_coremask_clear_self(cvmx_coremask_t *pcm)
00307 {
00308     return cvmx_coremask_clear_core(pcm, cvmx_get_core_num());
00309 }
00310 #endif
00311 
00312 /**
00313  * Toggle ``core'' in the coremask.
00314  *
00315  * @param pcm is the pointer to the coremask.
00316  * @param core
00317  * @return 0.
00318  */
00319 static inline int cvmx_coremask_toggle_core(cvmx_coremask_t *pcm, int core)
00320 {
00321     int n, i;
00322 
00323     n = core % CVMX_COREMASK_HLDRSZ;
00324     i = core / CVMX_COREMASK_HLDRSZ;
00325     pcm->coremask_bitmap[i] ^= ((cvmx_coremask_holder_t)1 << n);
00326 
00327     return 0;
00328 }
00329 
00330 /**
00331  * Toggle ``current core'' in the coremask.
00332  *
00333  * @param pcm is the pointer to the coremask.
00334  * @return 0.
00335  */
00336 static inline int cvmx_coremask_toggle_self(cvmx_coremask_t *pcm)
00337 {
00338     return cvmx_coremask_toggle_core(pcm, cvmx_get_core_num());
00339 }
00340 
00341 /**
00342  * Set the lower 64-bit of the coremask.
00343  * @param pcm   pointer to coremask
00344  * @param coremask_64   64-bit coremask to apply to the first node (0)
00345  */
00346 static inline void cvmx_coremask_set64(cvmx_coremask_t *pcm,
00347                        uint64_t coremask_64)
00348 {
00349     pcm->coremask_bitmap[0] = coremask_64;
00350 }
00351 
00352 /**
00353  * Set the 64-bit of the coremask for a particular node.
00354  * @param pcm   pointer to coremask
00355  * @param node  node to set
00356  * @param coremask_64   64-bit coremask to apply to the specified node
00357  */
00358 static inline void cvmx_coremask_set64_node(cvmx_coremask_t *pcm,
00359                         uint8_t node,
00360                         uint64_t coremask_64)
00361 {
00362 
00363     pcm->coremask_bitmap[CVMX_COREMASK_BMP_NODE_CORE_IDX(node, 0)] =
00364                                 coremask_64;
00365 }
00366 
00367 /**
00368  * Gets the lower 64-bits of the coremask
00369  *
00370  * @param[in] pcm - pointer to coremask
00371  * @return 64-bit coremask for the first node
00372  */
00373 static inline uint64_t cvmx_coremask_get64(const cvmx_coremask_t *pcm)
00374 {
00375     return pcm->coremask_bitmap[0];
00376 }
00377 
00378 /**
00379  * Gets the lower 64-bits of the coremask for the specified node
00380  *
00381  * @param[in] pcm - pointer to coremask
00382  * @param node - node to get coremask for
00383  * @return 64-bit coremask for the first node
00384  */
00385 static inline uint64_t cvmx_coremask_get64_node(const cvmx_coremask_t *pcm,
00386                         uint8_t node)
00387 {
00388     return pcm->coremask_bitmap[CVMX_COREMASK_BMP_NODE_CORE_IDX(node, 0)];
00389 }
00390 
00391 /**
00392  * Gets the lower 32-bits of the coremask for compatibility
00393  *
00394  * @param[in] pcm - pointer to coremask
00395  * @return 32-bit coremask for the first node
00396  * @deprecated This function is to maintain compatibility with older
00397  *             SDK applications and may disappear at some point.
00398  * This function is not compatible with the CN78XX or any other
00399  * Octeon device with more than 32 cores.
00400  */
00401 static inline uint32_t cvmx_coremask_get32(const cvmx_coremask_t *pcm)
00402 {
00403     return pcm->coremask_bitmap[0] & 0xffffffff;
00404 }
00405 
00406 /*
00407  * cvmx_coremask_cmp() returns an integer less than, equal to, or
00408  * greater than zero if *pcm1 is found, respectively, to be less than,
00409  * to match, or be greater than *pcm2.
00410  */
00411 static inline int cvmx_coremask_cmp(const cvmx_coremask_t *pcm1,
00412                     const cvmx_coremask_t *pcm2)
00413 {
00414     int i;
00415     /* Start from highest node for arithemtically correct result */
00416     for ( i = CVMX_COREMASK_USED_BMPSZ-1; i >= 0 ; i-- )
00417         if( pcm1->coremask_bitmap[i] != pcm2->coremask_bitmap[i] )
00418             return (pcm1->coremask_bitmap[i] > pcm2->coremask_bitmap[i]) ? 1 : -1;
00419 
00420     return 0;
00421 }
00422 
00423 /*
00424  * cvmx_coremask_OPx(pcm1, pcm2[, pcm3]), where OPx can be
00425  * - and
00426  * - or
00427  * - xor
00428  * - not
00429  * ...
00430  * For binary operators, pcm3 <-- pcm1 OPX pcm2.
00431  * For unaries, pcm2 <-- OPx pcm1.
00432  */
00433 #define CVMX_COREMASK_BINARY_DEFUN(binary_op, op)           \
00434     static inline int cvmx_coremask_##binary_op(            \
00435         cvmx_coremask_t *pcm1,                  \
00436         const cvmx_coremask_t *pcm2,                \
00437         const cvmx_coremask_t *pcm3)                \
00438     {                               \
00439         int i;                          \
00440                                     \
00441         for (i = 0; i < CVMX_COREMASK_USED_BMPSZ; i++)      \
00442             pcm1->coremask_bitmap[i] =          \
00443                 pcm2->coremask_bitmap[i]            \
00444                 op                  \
00445                 pcm3->coremask_bitmap[i];           \
00446                                     \
00447         return 0;                       \
00448     }
00449 
00450 #define CVMX_COREMASK_UNARY_DEFUN(unary_op, op)             \
00451     static inline int cvmx_coremask_##unary_op(         \
00452         cvmx_coremask_t *pcm1,                  \
00453         const cvmx_coremask_t *pcm2)                \
00454     {                               \
00455         int i;                          \
00456                                     \
00457         for (i = 0; i < CVMX_COREMASK_USED_BMPSZ; i++)      \
00458             pcm1->coremask_bitmap[i] =          \
00459                 op                      \
00460                 pcm2->coremask_bitmap[i];           \
00461                                     \
00462         return 0;                       \
00463     }
00464 
00465 CVMX_COREMASK_BINARY_DEFUN(and, &)  /* cvmx_coremask_and(pcm1, pcm2, pcm3): pcm1 = pmc2 & pmc3 */
00466 CVMX_COREMASK_BINARY_DEFUN(or, |)   /* cvmx_coremask_or(pcm1, pcm2, pcm3): pcm1 = pmc2 | pmc3  */
00467 CVMX_COREMASK_BINARY_DEFUN(xor, ^)  /* cvmx_coremask_xor(pcm1, pcm2, pcm3): pcm1 = pmc2 ^ pmc3 */
00468 CVMX_COREMASK_BINARY_DEFUN(maskoff, & ~) /* cvmx_coremask_maskoff(pcm1, pcm2, pcm3): pcm1 = pmc2 & ~pmc3 */
00469 CVMX_COREMASK_UNARY_DEFUN(not, ~)   /* cvmx_coremask_not(pcm1, pcm2): pcm1 = ~pcm2       */
00470 CVMX_COREMASK_UNARY_DEFUN(fill, -1 | )  /* cvmx_coremask_fill(pcm1, pcm2): pcm1 = -1      */
00471 CVMX_COREMASK_UNARY_DEFUN(clear, 0 &) /* cvmx_coremask_clear(pcm1, pcm2): pcm1 = 0     */
00472 CVMX_COREMASK_UNARY_DEFUN(dup, +)   /* cvmx_coremask_dup(pcm1, pcm2): pcm1 = pcm2       */
00473 
00474 /*
00475  * Macros using the unary functions defined w/
00476  * CVMX_COREMASK_UNARY_DEFUN
00477  * - set *pcm to its complement
00478  * - set all bits in *pcm to 0
00479  * - set all (valid) bits in *pcm to 1
00480  */
00481 #define cvmx_coremask_complement(pcm)   cvmx_coremask_not(pcm, pcm)
00482 /* On clear, even clear the unused bits */
00483 #define cvmx_coremask_clear_all(pcm)    do {*(pcm) = (cvmx_coremask_t)CVMX_COREMASK_EMPTY;} while (0)
00484 #define cvmx_coremask_set_all(pcm)  cvmx_coremask_fill(pcm, NULL)
00485 
00486 /*
00487  * convert a string of hex digits to cvmx_coremask_t
00488  *
00489  * @param pcm
00490  * @param hexstr can be
00491  *  - "[1-9A-Fa-f][0-9A-Fa-f]*", or
00492  *  - "-1" to set the bits for all the cores.
00493  * return
00494  *   0 for success,
00495  *  -1 for string too long (i.e., hexstr takes more bits than
00496  *     CVMX_MIPS_MAX_CORES),
00497  *  -2 for conversion problems from hex string to an unsigned
00498  *     long long, e.g., non-hex char in hexstr, and
00499  *  -3 for hexstr starting with '0'.
00500  * NOTE:
00501  *  This function clears the bitmask in *pcm before the conversion.
00502  */
00503 extern int cvmx_coremask_str2bmp(cvmx_coremask_t *pcm, char *hexstr);
00504 
00505 /*
00506  * convert a cvmx_coremask_t to a string of hex digits
00507  *
00508  * @param pcm
00509  * @param hexstr is "[1-9A-Fa-f][0-9A-Fa-f]*"
00510  *
00511  * return 0.
00512  */
00513 extern int cvmx_coremask_bmp2str(const cvmx_coremask_t *pcm, char *hexstr);
00514 
00515 /*
00516  * Returns the index of the lowest bit in a coremask holder.
00517  */
00518 static inline int cvmx_coremask_lowest_bit(cvmx_coremask_holder_t h)
00519 {
00520     return __builtin_ctzll(h);
00521 }
00522 
00523 /*
00524  * Returns the 0-based index of the highest bit in a coremask holder.
00525  */
00526 static inline int cvmx_coremask_highest_bit(cvmx_coremask_holder_t h)
00527 {
00528     return (64 - __builtin_clzll(h) - 1);
00529 }
00530 
00531 /**
00532  * Returns the last core within the coremask and -1 when the coremask
00533  * is empty.
00534  *
00535  * @param[in] pcm - pointer to coremask
00536  * @returns last core set in the coremask or -1 if all clear
00537  *
00538  */
00539 static inline int cvmx_coremask_get_last_core(const cvmx_coremask_t *pcm)
00540 {
00541     int i;
00542     int found = -1;
00543 
00544     for (i = 0; i < CVMX_COREMASK_USED_BMPSZ; i++) {
00545         if (pcm->coremask_bitmap[i])
00546             found = i;
00547     }
00548 
00549     if (found == -1)
00550         return -1;
00551 
00552     return found * CVMX_COREMASK_HLDRSZ +
00553          cvmx_coremask_highest_bit(pcm->coremask_bitmap[found]);
00554 }
00555 
00556 /**
00557  * Returns the first core within the coremask and -1 when the coremask
00558  * is empty.
00559  *
00560  * @param[in] pcm - pointer to coremask
00561  * @returns first core set in the coremask or -1 if all clear
00562  *
00563  */
00564 static inline int cvmx_coremask_get_first_core(const cvmx_coremask_t *pcm)
00565 {
00566     int i;
00567 
00568     for (i = 0; i < CVMX_COREMASK_USED_BMPSZ; i++)
00569         if (pcm->coremask_bitmap[i])
00570             break;
00571 
00572     if (i == CVMX_COREMASK_USED_BMPSZ)
00573         return -1;
00574 
00575     return i * CVMX_COREMASK_HLDRSZ +
00576         cvmx_coremask_lowest_bit(pcm->coremask_bitmap[i]);
00577 }
00578 
00579 /**
00580  * Given a core and coremask, return the next available core in the coremask
00581  * or -1 if none are available.
00582  *
00583  * @param core - starting core to check (can be -1 for core 0)
00584  * @param pcm - pointer to coremask to check for the next core.
00585  *
00586  * @return next core following the core parameter or -1 if no more cores.
00587  */
00588 static inline int cvmx_coremask_next_core(int core,
00589                       const cvmx_coremask_t *pcm)
00590 {
00591     int n, i;
00592     core++;
00593     n = core % CVMX_COREMASK_HLDRSZ;
00594     i = core / CVMX_COREMASK_HLDRSZ;
00595 
00596     if (pcm->coremask_bitmap[i] != 0) {
00597         for (; n < CVMX_COREMASK_HLDRSZ; n++)
00598             if (pcm->coremask_bitmap[i] & (1ULL << n))
00599                 return ((i * CVMX_COREMASK_HLDRSZ) + n);
00600     }
00601     for (i = i + 1; i < CVMX_COREMASK_USED_BMPSZ; i++) {
00602         if (pcm->coremask_bitmap[i] != 0)
00603             return (i * CVMX_COREMASK_HLDRSZ) +
00604                 cvmx_coremask_lowest_bit(pcm->coremask_bitmap[i]);
00605     }
00606     return -1;
00607 }
00608 
00609 /**
00610  * Compute coremask for count cores starting with start_core.
00611  * Note that the coremask for multi-node processors may have
00612  * gaps.
00613  *
00614  * @param[out]  pcm        pointer to core mask data structure
00615  * @param   start_core starting code number
00616  * @param       count      number of cores
00617  *
00618  */
00619 static inline void cvmx_coremask_set_cores(cvmx_coremask_t *pcm,
00620                        unsigned int start_core,
00621                        unsigned int count)
00622 {
00623     int node;
00624     int core;   /** Current core in node */
00625     int cores_in_node;
00626     int i;
00627 #ifndef __linux__
00628     assert(CVMX_MAX_CORES < CVMX_COREMASK_HLDRSZ);
00629 #endif
00630     node = start_core >> CVMX_NODE_NO_SHIFT;
00631     core = start_core & ((1 << CVMX_NODE_NO_SHIFT) - 1);
00632 #ifndef __linux__
00633     assert(core < CVMX_MAX_CORES);
00634 #endif
00635 
00636     cvmx_coremask_clear_all(pcm);
00637     while (count > 0) {
00638         if (count + core > CVMX_MAX_CORES)
00639             cores_in_node = CVMX_MAX_CORES - core;
00640         else
00641             cores_in_node = count;
00642 
00643         i = CVMX_COREMASK_BMP_NODE_CORE_IDX(node, core);
00644         pcm->coremask_bitmap[i] = ((1ULL << cores_in_node) - 1) << core;
00645         count -= cores_in_node;
00646         core = 0;
00647         node++;
00648     }
00649 }
00650 
00651 
00652 /**
00653  * Makes a copy of a coremask
00654  *
00655  * @param[out] dest - pointer to destination coremask
00656  * @param[in]  src  - pointer to source coremask
00657  */
00658 static inline void cvmx_coremask_copy(cvmx_coremask_t *dest,
00659                       const cvmx_coremask_t *src)
00660 {
00661     memcpy(dest, src, sizeof(*dest));
00662 }
00663 
00664 /**
00665  * Test to see if the specified core is first core in coremask.
00666  *
00667  * @param[in]  pcm  pointer to the coremask to test against
00668  * @param[in]  core core to check
00669  *
00670  * @return  1 if the core is first core in the coremask, 0 otherwise
00671  *
00672  */
00673 static inline int
00674 cvmx_coremask_is_core_first_core(const cvmx_coremask_t *pcm,
00675                  unsigned int core)
00676 {
00677     int n, i;
00678     n = core / CVMX_COREMASK_HLDRSZ;
00679 
00680 
00681     for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
00682         if (pcm->coremask_bitmap[i] != 0)
00683             return 0;
00684     /* From now on we only care about the core number within an entry */
00685     core &= (CVMX_COREMASK_HLDRSZ - 1);
00686     if (__builtin_ffsll(pcm->coremask_bitmap[n]) < (core + 1))
00687         return 0;
00688     return (__builtin_ffsll(pcm->coremask_bitmap[n]) == core + 1);
00689 }
00690 
00691 /*
00692  * NOTE:
00693  * cvmx_coremask_is_first_core() was retired due to improper usage.
00694  * For inquiring about the current core being the initializing
00695  * core for an application, use cvmx_is_init_core().
00696  * For simply inquring if the current core is numerically
00697  * lowest in a given mask, use :
00698  *  cvmx_coremask_is_core_first_core( pcm, dvmx_get_core_num())
00699  */
00700 
00701 /**
00702  * Returns the number of 1 bits set in a coremask
00703  *
00704  * @param[in] pcm - pointer to core mask
00705  *
00706  * @return number of bits set in the coremask
00707  */
00708 static inline int cvmx_coremask_get_core_count(const cvmx_coremask_t *pcm)
00709 {
00710     int i;
00711     int count = 0;
00712 
00713     for (i = 0; i < CVMX_COREMASK_USED_BMPSZ; i++)
00714         count += __builtin_popcountll(pcm->coremask_bitmap[i]);
00715 
00716     return count;
00717 }
00718 
00719 /**
00720  * For multi-node systems, return the node a core belongs to.
00721  *
00722  * @param core - core number (0-1023)
00723  *
00724  * @return node number core belongs to
00725  */
00726 static inline int cvmx_coremask_core_to_node(int core)
00727 {
00728     return (core >> CVMX_NODE_NO_SHIFT) & CVMX_NODE_MASK;
00729 }
00730 
00731 /**
00732  * Given a core number on a multi-node system, return the core number for a
00733  * particular node.
00734  *
00735  * @param core - global core number
00736  *
00737  * @returns core number local to the node.
00738  */
00739 static inline int cvmx_coremask_core_on_node(int core)
00740 {
00741     return (core & ((1 << CVMX_NODE_NO_SHIFT) - 1));
00742 }
00743 
00744 
00745 /**
00746  * Returns if one coremask is a subset of another coremask
00747  *
00748  * @param main - main coremask to test
00749  * @param subset - subset coremask to test
00750  *
00751  * @return 0 if the subset contains cores not in the main coremask or 1 if
00752  *         the subset is fully contained in the main coremask.
00753  */
00754 static inline int cvmx_coremask_is_subset(const cvmx_coremask_t *main,
00755                       const cvmx_coremask_t *subset)
00756 {
00757     int i;
00758 
00759     for (i = 0; i < CVMX_COREMASK_USED_BMPSZ; i++)
00760         if ((main->coremask_bitmap[i] & subset->coremask_bitmap[i]) !=
00761             subset->coremask_bitmap[i])
00762             return 0;
00763     return 1;
00764 }
00765 
00766 /**
00767  * Returns if one coremask intersects another coremask
00768  *
00769  * @param c1 - main coremask to test
00770  * @param c2 - subset coremask to test
00771  *
00772  * @return 1 if coremask c1 intersects coremask c2, 0 if they are exclusive
00773  */
00774 static inline int cvmx_coremask_intersects(const cvmx_coremask_t *c1,
00775                        const cvmx_coremask_t *c2)
00776 {
00777     int i;
00778 
00779     for (i = 0; i < CVMX_COREMASK_USED_BMPSZ; i++)
00780         if ((c1->coremask_bitmap[i] & c2->coremask_bitmap[i]) != 0)
00781             return 1;
00782     return 0;
00783 }
00784 
00785 /**
00786  * Masks a single node of a coremask
00787  *
00788  * @param pcm - coremask to mask [inout]
00789  * @param node       - node number to mask against
00790  */
00791 static inline void cvmx_coremask_mask_node(cvmx_coremask_t *pcm, int node)
00792 {
00793     int i;
00794 
00795     for (i = 0; i < CVMX_COREMASK_BMP_NODE_CORE_IDX(node, 0); i++)
00796         pcm->coremask_bitmap[i] = 0;
00797     for (i = CVMX_COREMASK_BMP_NODE_CORE_IDX(node + 1, 0);
00798          i < CVMX_COREMASK_USED_BMPSZ; i++)
00799         pcm->coremask_bitmap[i] = 0;
00800 }
00801 
00802 /**
00803  * Wait (stall) until all cores in the given coremask has reached this point
00804  * in the program execution before proceeding.
00805  *
00806  * @param  pcm  the group of cores performing the barrier sync
00807  *
00808  */
00809 extern void cvmx_coremask_barrier_sync(const cvmx_coremask_t *pcm);
00810 
00811 /**
00812  * Prints out a coremask in the form of node X: 0x... 0x...
00813  *
00814  * @param[in] pcm - pointer to core mask
00815  *
00816  * @return nothing
00817  */
00818 void cvmx_coremask_print(const cvmx_coremask_t *pcm);
00819 
00820 static inline void cvmx_coremask_dprint(const cvmx_coremask_t *pcm)
00821 {
00822 #if defined(__U_BOOT__) && defined(DEBUG)
00823     cvmx_coremask_print(pcm);
00824 #else
00825   (void)(pcm);
00826 #endif
00827 }

00830  * Gets the 'avail_coremask' from the dedicated (BOOTINFO) named block
00831  * @param[out] coremask pointer where to copy avail_coremask
00832  * @return 0 on success, -1 otherwise
00833  */
00834 extern int cvmx_get_avail_coremask(cvmx_coremask_t *coremask);
